titleInfo.title: 1925 Letter from T. H. Alexander to Malcolm R. Patterson

subject.topic: Evolution (Biology) - Study and teaching - Law and legislation

mods.abstract: Letter, written shortly after the end of the Scopes Trial, sent to former governor Malcolm R. Patterson by Nashville Tennessean managing editor and Governor Austin Peay advisor, Truman Alexander. Alexander sought to inform Patterson of William Jennings; Bryan's regard for him and his desire to have Patterson as a member of the prosecution team at the John T. Scopes Trial.

relatedItem.abstract: Without a doubt, the question, “where do humans come from?” was asked long before Charles Darwin published Origin of Species in 1859. Yet throughout the twentieth century and into the twenty-first century, the debate amongst members of the scientific and religious communities has continued to be a divisive and widely debated topic. The Scopes “Monkey” Trial is perhaps one of the critical events of this controversy and one of the landmark legal decisions of the twentieth century...
